Jeff,
Assuming the term "indirect encoding" is being used to represent the =
explicite non-activation, in a neural network type of context, of the indiv=
idual structure in question, I would agree to that point. But the HyperNeat=
 exploitation of design space regularity with nuanced irregularities, and u=
tilization of nodal transfer functions and connection weight determination,=
 departs from my intended meaning. Specifically, any prior applications of =
NEAT in which the actual individual structure and traits are the output bei=
ng passed to the arbitrary objective function evaluation and subsequent evo=
lution by NEAT?

Thanks,
Andy

--- In neat@yahoogroups.com, Jeff Clune <jef=
fclune@...> wrote:
>
> Hi Andy-
> 
> That is exactly what we did in our "Ta=
rget Weights" problem in the following paper:
> 
> Clune J, Stanley KO, Pen=
nock RT, Ofria C (2011) On the performance of indirect encoding across the =
continuum of regularity. IEEE Transactions on Evolutionary Computation. 15(=
3): 346-367.
> 
> http://goo.gl/qYHPR
> 
> Only difference was that it was =
with HyperNEAT and not NEAT. 
> 
> Best regards,
> Jeff Clune
> 
> Postdoct=
oral Fellow

> Cornell Universit=
